main event: In September 1957, a round white object, the size of a softball, was observed for three to four minutes, traveling very fast and looking at the sky.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by a USAF Colonel from the Intelligence Division.
The object was described as very bright-white and traveling very fast.
There was uncertainty about the object's nature, with comments indicating the possibility of it being an aircraft.
The observation was made at two different locations by USCG personnel at lighthouse stations.
The temperature and cloud formation at the time of the sighting were documented.
sighted object: one round white object, resembling a softball
location: unknown, observed by USCG personnel at lighthouse stations
